description_top: Biblia Hebraica: Nevi’im Rishonim. Commentary by David Kimhi
title: Biblia Hebraica: Nevi’im Rishonim. Commentary by David Kimhi
description: Incunable edition of the Former Prophets in Hebrew.
contents_note: The book was printed in 1485 but later owners have added marginal annotations and corrections in Hebrew, as well as chapter numbers, in 16th and 17th century hands.
layout: Main biblical text has been printed in square script, the commentary surrounds the main text and is printed in semi-cursive script.
extent: ff. ii empty leaves + 167 leaves + ii empty leaves (all foliated).
dimensions: 271 x 208 x 37 mm (size of binding); ca. 264 x 192 mm (size of leaf).
decoration: Decorated (manuscript) incipit of the book of Kings (fol. 108v) and woodcut decorated initial word panels at the beginning of the books of Joshua (fol. 2r) and Judges (fol. 44v).
binding: Late 18th or early 19th century calf over pasteboards, with gold-tooled borders; sewn onto five supports; with imprint details (in gilt) and shelfmark on the spine; text block edges stained red.
provenance: Jacob Georg Christian Adler (1756-1834), German Orientalist and professor of Syriac language at the University of Copenhagen. Provenance inscription on front flyleaf reads: ‘Adler’.
record_origin: Material Evidence in Incunabula catalogue https://data.cerl.org/mei/02124371.
additional_information_sources: Rahel Fronda, ‘Collection of Hebrew Incunabula at Christ Church’, in Christ Church Library Newsletter, Volume 11 (2019).
